<JD_START>
Job Title: Finance Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance, Sales

Description:
Are you a passionate Finance Leader desiring to contribute to a company positively impacting human health?
Our client is a leading BioPharmaceutical company dedicated to developing innovative treatments for chronic diseases. They offer a collaborative and supportive remote work environment that empowers our employees to excel.
You will lead a team of talented finance professionals, overseeing all aspects of financial operations for the US region. You will be a strategic partner to the leadership team, providing financial insights and analysis to support informed decision-making.
Responsibilities:Manage and lead a team of finance professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration and high performance.Oversee the full financial cycle, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and month-end close processes.Ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial data, maintaining strong internal controls.Partner with cross-functional teams to provide financial analysis and support strategic initiatives.Develop and implement financial reporting processes that meet US GAAP and internal reporting requirements.Manage relationships with external auditors and ensure timely completion of audits.Stay up-to-date on relevant financial regulations and accounting standards.Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy within the finance department.
About You:Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.3+ years of experience in a finance leadership role, preferably within the life sciences or biopharmaceutical industry.Proven track record of leading and motivating a team of finance professionals.Strong understanding of US GAAP accounting principles.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Experience with financial modeling, forecasting, and budgeting.Proficient in financial reporting software.Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
Benefits:Competitive salary and benefits package.Opportunity to work for a company at the forefront of human health innovation.Flexible remote work environment.Continuous learning and development opportunities.Be part of a collaborative and supportive team culture.
If you're interested in the above role, then please click apply.
Consult will endeavour to contact candidates within 14 days of application. However, if you do not hear back after 2 weeks then please assume on this occasion, unfortunately, you have not been successful.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
